function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Construction professionals may have varied perceptions of the COVID-19 impact on construction, leading to a lack of consensus in response planning.","Impact":"Ineffective response plans may be implemented, leading to increased risk of disease propagation in construction environments.","Mitigation":"Conduct comprehensive surveys and interviews to understand the range of perceptions and incorporate diverse viewpoints into response planning.","Technologies":"Survey and data analysis tools for capturing and analyzing perceptions.","People":"Construction professionals, construction managers.","Owner":"Research institutions, government agencies."},{"Description":"Global and regional differences in perceived impacts of COVID-19 on construction may lead to localized response plans that do not account for broader patterns of disease propagation.","Impact":"Localized response plans may be insufficient to contain the spread of the disease, leading to continued transmission in certain regions.","Mitigation":"Compare and integrate perceptions from different regions to develop response plans that address both local and global patterns of disease propagation.","Technologies":"Data visualization and analysis tools for identifying global and regional patterns.","People":"Construction professionals, public health officials.","Owner":"International organizations, research institutions."},{"Description":"Perceptions of professionals at different points in time may not accurately reflect the evolving nature of the pandemic, leading to outdated response plans.","Impact":"Outdated response plans may not account for current disease transmission dynamics, increasing the risk of contagion in construction environments.","Mitigation":"Conduct longitudinal studies to track changes in perceptions over time and update response plans accordingly.","Technologies":"Longitudinal survey platforms, data tracking and analysis tools.","People":"Construction professionals, epidemiologists, public health experts.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health agencies."}]}
